comparative_insights: Documents exhibit 4 distinct political ideologies, with liberalism being the most prevalent.
The dominant economic system across documents is feudalism, appearing in 6 documents.
The most common governance system is monarchy, found in 10 documents.
On average, military power has the highest distribution (36.40%) across documents.
On average, documents describe positive social impacts.

insights: Political Ideology decreasing by 53.3% from 1137 to 2019.
Socioeconomic Structure increasing by 88.7% from 1137 to 2019.
Governance Power decreasing by 17.8% from 1137 to 2019.
Social Impact decreasing by 100.0% from 1137 to 2019.

nlp_pipeline.text_cleaning: Unicode normalization, entity protection, OCR error correction
nlp_pipeline.feature_extraction: TF-IDF, BOW, semantic embeddings, topic modeling

analysis_methods.governance_power: Power distribution analysis with system classification
analysis_methods.social_impact: Impact indicator scoring with net impact calculation

evidence_extraction.citations: Text excerpts from summaries and key entities

methodological_limitations: Lexicon-based analysis may miss nuanced ideological expressions
Historical spelling variations may not all be captured
OCR quality affects text extraction accuracy
Entity recognition depends on gazetteer completeness
data_limitations: Temporal coverage depends on document selection
analytical_limitations: Temporal evolution limited by document distribution
Clustering results depend on feature selection
trade_offs: Speed vs accuracy in feature extraction
Preservation vs normalization in text processing
